gurmukhi: igirE JUm BUmM gey pRwx Cu`tM ] mno myr ko swqvO siRMg tu`tM ]24]
transliteration: Girio Jhoom Bhooman Gad Praan Chhouttan|| Mano Mer Ko Saatvau Sring Touttan||24||
translation: Who swayed, fell down of the goround and breathed his last. It seemed that the seventh peak of Sumeru mountain had fallen down.24.

gurmukhi: igry bIr ipMgwC dyvI sMGwry ] cly Aaur bIrM hiQAwrM auGwry ]
transliteration: Gire Boor Pingadchh Devoo Sanhdare|| Chale Aur Booran Hathiaaran Oughdare||
translation: When the warriors like Pingachh fell in the field, other warriors holding their weapons marched forward.

gurmukhi: qbY ros dyibXM sroGM clwey ] ibnw pRwn kY ju`D mDM igrwey ]25]
transliteration: Tabai Ros Debiyan Daroghan Chadhaae|| Binaa Praan Kai Juddh Madhan Giraae||25||
translation: Then the goddess in great ire shot many arrows, which laid to rest many warriors in the battlefield.25.

gurmukhi: jy jy s`qRu swmuhy Awey ] sBY dyvqw mwir igrwey ]
transliteration: Je Je Sattr(u) Saamuhe Aae|| Sabhai Devtaa Daar(i) Giraae||
translation: The enemies who came before the goddess, they were all killed by her.

gurmukhi: sYnw skl jbY hin fwrI ] Awsurys kopw AhMkwrI ]26]
transliteration: Sainaa Sakal Jabai Han(i) Ddaroo|| Aasures Kopaa Abankdaroo||26||
translation: When all the army was thus effaced, then the egoistic demon-king was filled with rage.26.

gurmukhi: Awp ju`D qb kIAw BvwnI ] cun cun hny pKrIAw bwnI ]
transliteration: Aap Juddh Tab Kooaa Bhavaanoo|| Choun Choun Hane Pakdarooaa Baanoo||
translation: Then the goddess Durga herself waged the war, and picked up and killed the warriors wearing armour.

gurmukhi: kRoD juAwl msqk qy ibgsI ] qw qy Awp kwlkw inksI ]27]
transliteration: Krodh Juaal Mastak Te Bigadoo|| Taa Te Aap Kaalka Nikasoo||27||
translation: The flame of ire manifested itself from her forehead, which appeared in the form of goddess kalka.27.
The flames of fire come from her mouth and she herself came out from the forehead (of Durga).
She killed the great elephants and the warriors on horseback.28.
The arrows are being shot and the swords are glistening.
The daggers are being struck and it appears that the festival of Holi is being celebrated.29.
The weapons are being use unhesitatingly, which create clattering sounds.
